finalisedFormData.title: Preparation for effective trial
finalisedFormData.name: Jane JOHNSON, 22 May 1976, created on 22 December 10:45 2022

fields.value: collects information about the case that the court will need to arrange for an effective trial
fields.subValue:
CrimPR rules 3.2 and 3.3
CrimPR rule 3.5
CrimPR 1.2(1) & 3.12

subSections.heading: After the court gives directions for trial, you must tell the court at once if:

fields.value: information about the case changes, or,
you think another direction is needed

fields.label: ccd
fields.value:
Liverpool Magistrates’ Court
Derby Square
Liverpool
L2 1XA

fields.label: Offences
fields.value:
Aid abet the driving of a motor vehicle with a proportion of a specified controlled drug above the specified limit
Racially / religiously aggravated harassment with fear of violence

fields.label: Defendant’s representative
fields.value:
Chris Elisasson
25 King St, Farnborough, GU53 7GH
0208 675 2726

fields.label: Offences
fields.value:
Aid abet the driving of a motor vehicle with a proportion of a specified controlled drug above the specified limit
Racially / religiously aggravated harassment with fear of violence

fields.label: Defendant’s representative
fields.value:
Chris Elisasson
25 King St, Farnborough, GU53 7GH
0208 675 2726

fields.label: 4.1 Evidence
fields.question: Does the prosecutor intend to serve more evidence?
fields.value:
Yes
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet. Quisque vulputate lorem dolor, eu porta dui varius at.

fields.label: 4.2 Disclosure of unused prosecution material
fields.question: Has the initial duty of disclosure of unused prosecution material been complied with?
fields.value:
Yes
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet.

fields.label: 4.3 Investigation
fields.question: Are there any pending enquiries or lines of investigation?
fields.value:
Yes
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

fields.label: 4.4 Modern Slavery Act
fields.question: Is there any suggestion that the defendant has been a victim of slavery or exploitation?

fields.label: 4.5 Prosecution case
fields.question: The prosecution will rely on:
fields.value:
Defendant’s admissions in interview
A record of the defendant’s interview
Electronically recorded evidence

fields.label: 4.6 Display equipment
fields.question: Will the prosecutor need any equipment in the trial courtroom? (e.g. live link or other media player, etc.)
fields.value:
Yes
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet. Quisque vulputate lorem dolor, eu porta dui varius at.
fields.info: The prosecutor must make sure that any electronic media can be played in the courtroom.

fields.label: 4.7 Points of law
fields.question: Does the prosecutor presently expect the case to involve a complex, novel or unusual point of law and/or fact?

fields.label: 5.1 Prosecution witness requiring assistance, special measures, etc.
fields.question: Are there any prosecution witness requirements that may make special measures, reasonable adjustments or other support appropriate?

fields.label: 5.2 Ground rules for questioning
fields.question: Does the prosecutor want the court to arrange a discussion of ground rules for questioning?
fields.info: If an intermediary is appointed, the court must discuss ground rules with the intermediary and advocates. A discussion may be helpful in other cases.

fields.label: 5.3 Variation of standard directions
fields.question: Does the prosecutor want the court to vary a standard trial preparation time limit or make any other direction?
fields.value:
Yes
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet. Quisque vulputate lorem dolor, eu porta dui varius at.

subSections.label: 6 Advice on plea and absence
subSections.value: Credit for guilty plea; trial in absence

fields.label: 6a. Does the defendant understand that: they will receive credit for a guilty plea?
fields.info2: A guilty plea may affect the sentence and any order for costs and other financial penalties / charges

fields.label: 6b. Does the defendant understand that the trial and sentencing, if convicted, can go ahead even if they do not attend?
fields.info: CrimPR rule 24.12

fields.label: 7.1 Mixed pleas
fields.question:
If more than one offence is alleged, does the defendant want to plead guilty to any of them?
Which offences does the defendant want to plead guilty to?
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

fields.label: 7.2 Basis of plea
fields.question: Does the defendant want to plead guilty, but not on the facts alleged? Provide details of the facts on which the defendant wants to plead guilty.
fields.info: Not applicable

fields.label: 7.3 Different offence
fields.question:
Does the defendant want to plead guilty, but to a different offence?
What offence does the defendant want to plead guilty to?
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

subSections.label: 8. Case management information
subSections.value: Initial details of the prosecution case should have been served: CrimPR rule 8.2. Questions 8.1, 8.2, 8.3 and 8.4 are to help the court find out what is in dispute and give appropriate directions for trial.

fields.label: 8.1a Presence
fields.question: The defendant was present at the scene of the offence alleged

fields.label: 8.1b Involvement
fields.question: The defendant [[carried out] [took part in] the conduct alleged] [drove the vehicle involved]

fields.label: 8.1c Injury / loss / damage
fields.question: [Nature of injury] [extent of loss or damage] alleged by the prosecution

fields.label: 8.1d Identification
fields.question:
The defendant was correctly identified
Explain what is in dispute
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

fields.label: 8.1e Lawful arrest
fields.question:
The defendant was arrested lawfully
Explain what is in dispute
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

fields.label: 8.1f Interview
fields.question: The defendant’s interview [summary] [record] is accurate

fields.label: 8.1g Fingerprints /DNA
fields.question: Fingerprint / DNA evidence4

fields.label: 8.1h Scientific evidence
fields.question: [Medical] [identification of drug] [other scientific] prosecution evidence

fields.label: 8.1i Alcohol /Drug testing procedure
fields.question: The [alcohol] [drug] testing procedure was carried out correctly

fields.label: 8.1j Disqualification / court order (e.g. restraining order)
fields.question: The defendant was [disqualified from driving] [subject to the court order specified] at the time of the offence alleged

fields.label: 8.1k Continuity
fields.question: Exhibits and samples were collected and delivered as stated by the prosecution (i.e. continuity)

fields.label: 8.1l Anticipated defence(s)
fields.question: The defendant is likely to rely upon:

If there is any suggestion that the defendant has been a victim of slavery or exploitation, give details including the date of any reference to the national referral mechanism. If any other defence is anticipated, give an outline.
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

fields.question: Can any facts which are not in dispute be recorded in a written admission? Undisputed facts can be admitted by reference to a statement accepted in paragraph 8.1, e.g. “I admit 8.1(a)and (e).” Facts which are admitted are evidence: CrimPR rule 24.6 & Criminal Justice Act 1967, s.10.
fields.value: Yes, one will be provided now
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

subSections.label: 8.3 Issues
subSections.question: What are the real issues in this case?

fields.question: (a) Explain what particular facts are in dispute, if any, in addition to those identified in paragraph 8.1?
fields.value: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet. Quisque vulputate lorem dolor, eu porta dui varius at.

fields.question: (b) Explain what matters of law are in dispute, if any?
fields.value: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet. Quisque vulputate lorem dolor, eu porta dui varius at.

fields.question: Does the defendant presently expect the case to involve a complex, novel or unusual point of law and / or fact? Provide details
Does the defendant presently intend to give a defence statement?
fields.info2: Giving a defence statement is voluntary, but if one is given it must include the information collected in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.3 and must include particulars of facts relied on by the defence.

fields.question: What equipment (live link or other media player, etc.) will the defendant need in the trial courtroom?
fields.value: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar  lorem.
fields.info2: The defendant must make sure that any electronic media can be played in the courtroom.

fields.label: 9.1 Variation of standard directions
fields.question:
Does the defendant want the court to vary a standard trial preparation time limit or make any other direction?
Provide details
fields.info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem.

fields.label: 9.2 Defendant or defence witness requiring assistance, special measures, etc.
fields.question: Are there any defendant or defence witness requirements that may make special measures, reasonable adjustments or other support appropriate? If yes, give details in Part 4.

fields.label: 9.3 Ground rules for questioning
fields.question: Does the defendant want the court to arrange a discussion of ground rules for questioning?
fields.info2: If an intermediary is appointed, the court must discuss ground rules with the intermediary and advocates. A discussion may be helpful in other cases.

subSections.value: If this information changes, you must tell the court at once: CrimPR 1.2, 3.10

subFields.label: Name
subFields.col1Info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Fusce sit amet pulvinar lorem. Duis ultrices varius erat at aliquet.

directionsValues.value: Witness summons ordered for Sofia MATEO
The witness shall be escorted to the courtroom
Spanish interpreter ordered for Sofia MATEO
Live link ordered for Sofia MATEO
The defendant may not cross-examine Sofia MATEO and the court directs cross examination to be carried out by Christian Hawthorne.

fields.question: The defendant was [disqualified from driving] [subject to the court order specified] at the time of the offence alleged

fields.label: 8.1k Continuity
fields.question: Exhibits and samples were collected and delivered as stated by the prosecution (i.e. continuity)

fields.label: 8.1l Anticipated defence(s)
fields.question: The defendant is likely to rely upon:

If there is any suggestion that the defendant has been a victim of slavery or exploitation, give details including the date of any reference to the national referral mechanism. If any other defence is anticipated, give an outline.

fields.question: Can any facts which are not in dispute be recorded in a written admission? Undisputed facts can be admitted by reference to a statement accepted in paragraph 8.1, e.g. “I admit 8.1(a)and (e).” Facts which are admitted are evidence: CrimPR rule 24.6 & Criminal Justice Act 1967, s.10.
fields.value: Yes, one will be provided now

fields.question: Does the defendant presently expect the case to involve a complex, novel or unusual point of law and / or fact? Provide details
Does the defendant presently intend to give a defence statement?
fields.info2: Giving a defence statement is voluntary, but if one is given it must include the information collected in paragraphs 8.1 and 8.3 and must include particulars of facts relied on by the defence.

fields.question: What equipment (live link or other media player, etc.) will the defendant need in the trial courtroom?

fields.label: 9.2 Defendant or defence witness requiring assistance, special measures, etc.
fields.question: Are there any defendant or defence witness requirements that may make special measures, reasonable adjustments or other support appropriate? If yes, give details in Part 4.

fields.label: 9.3 Ground rules for questioning
fields.question: Does the defendant want the court to arrange a discussion of ground rules for questioning?
fields.info2: If an intermediary is appointed, the court must discuss ground rules with the intermediary and advocates. A discussion may be helpful in other cases.
